alert.note: Alert for Carter; Love (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 06 at 9:29PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of west central Johnston, north central Love, Carter and southern Murray Counties through 1015 PM CDT... At 929 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles southwest of Lone Grove, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Ardmore, Lone Grove, Healdton, Wilson, Dickson, Springer, Dougherty, Gene Autry, Overbrook, Lake Of The Arbuckles, Lake Murray, Turner Falls, and Milo. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 24 and 55. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
